qas.question: Which river did GE pollute with PCBs from its plant in Pittsfield, MA?
What were the primary contaminants contained in the pollution discharged into the Housatonic River?
Which company produced the Aroctor 1254 and Aroctor 1260?
How many pounds of PCBs are estimated to be retained in the sediment behind Woods Pond dam?
How high have the levels of PCBs in the sediments behind Woods Pond dam been measured at?
In what year was Monsanto founded?
How much Aroclor 1254 was found in Pittsfield?
In what year did Monsanto create Aroclor 1260?
How many pounds of PCBs are found in Pittsfield?
How much PCBs is found in waterfowl and fish in the Housatonic River?

context: From circa <b5_0>1932<b5_0/> until <b7_0>1977<b7_0/>, General Electric polluted the <a0_0>Housatonic River<a0_0/> with PCBs discharges from the General Electric plant at Pittsfield, Massachusetts. <a1_0>Aroclor 1254 and Aroclor 1260<a1_0/>, made by <a2_0>Monsanto<a2_0/> was the primary contaminant of the pollution. The highest concentrations of PCBs in the Housatonic River are found in Woods Pond in Lenox, Massachusetts, just south of Pittsfield, where they have been measured up to <a4_0><b6_0><b9_0>110 mg/kg<b9_0/><b6_0/><a4_0/> in the sediment. About 50% of all the PCBs currently in the river are estimated to be retained in the sediment behind Woods Pond dam. This is estimated to be about <a3_0><b8_0>11,000<b8_0/><a3_0/> pounds of PCBs. Former filled oxbows are also polluted. Waterfowl and fish who live in and around the river contain significant levels of PCBs and can present health risks if consumed.
